title: Battlesbridge Walks

images.title: John Winfield / Battlesbridge - the 'antiques' village
images.caption: Battlesbridge - the 'antiques' village. The majority of the buildings in the entire centre of this village are now devoted to the sale of antiques.

images.title: John Winfield / The old mill pond, Battlesbridge
images.caption: The old mill pond. Part of the River Crouch on west side of Battlesbridge - upstream from the granary mill.

images.title: Mill and weir, Battlesbridge by John Myers, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mill and weir, Battlesbridge

images.title: View from the riverbank by terry joyce, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View from the riverbank

images.title: High Tide at Battlesbridge by terry joyce, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: High Tide at Battlesbridge

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Crouch at Battlesbridge
images.caption: River Crouch at Battlesbridge. The bridge is the downstreammost on the River Crouch, and used to carry the A130 road until a bypass was built upstream. The name Battlesbridge is supposedly derived from the Bataille family who maintained the bridge for many years.

images.title: John Winfield / Battlesbridge Art and Antiques Centre
images.caption: Battlesbridge Art and Antiques Centre. The old granary mill on north bank of River Crouch - now converted to an antiques centre.

images.title: David Williams / Battlesbridge
images.caption: Autumn sunshine as the tide goes out on the River Crouch.

description: This Essex based village has some nice local trails along the River Crouch and a well known antiques centre housed in a picturesque old mill. It's a pleasant place for an easy stroll with nice riverside paths and some interesting old buildings to admire.
